security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation for AgentDB advanced features including network synchronization capabilities. While the documentation itself poses no direct security risk, the described features involve network communication and distributed systems that require proper security configuration in implementation.

medium_findings.title: Network synchronization exposes internal IPs
medium_findings.description: Documentation shows hardcoded internal IP addresses (192.168.1.10-12) for QUIC synchronization peers. In production, this could expose internal network topology if not properly configured with firewall rules and authentication.

medium_findings.title: QUIC sync enables cross-network communication
medium_findings.description: The skill documents QUIC synchronization that allows sub-millisecond data synchronization across network boundaries. While this is a feature, it requires careful security configuration to prevent unauthorized access to distributed databases.

low_findings.title: Firewall configuration requires elevated privileges
low_findings.description: Documentation suggests using 'sudo ufw allow 4433/udp' for firewall configuration, which requires system administrator privileges and could be misconfigured.

content.user_title: Master distributed AI databases with advanced vector search
content.value_statement: Build sophisticated multi-agent AI systems with sub-millisecond database synchronization and advanced search capabilities. AgentDB Advanced Features enables distributed vector databases with custom metrics, hybrid search, and QUIC networking for production-scale AI applications.
actual_capabilities: Configure QUIC synchronization for <1ms cross-node communication
Implement custom distance metrics for specialized vector comparisons
Build hybrid search combining vector similarity with metadata filtering
Manage multiple databases with sharding for horizontal scaling
Apply MMR algorithms for diverse search result generation
Synthesize context from multiple memory patterns
limitations: QUIC synchronization needs network configuration and firewall rules
Distributed systems knowledge required for optimal implementation
Performance depends on proper indexing and hardware resources

prompt_templates.title: Basic QUIC Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me configure QUIC synchronization between three AgentDB nodes at IPs 192.168.1.10, 192.168.1.11, and 192.168.1.12 on port 4433. Show me the complete configuration.

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a hybrid search query that finds similar research papers published after 2023 with at least 50 citations in the machine learning category. Use cosine similarity for the vector comparison.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Distance Metric
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a custom distance metric for product recommendations that weights price similarity at 40% and feature similarity at 60%. Show the implementation and integration with AgentDB.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Database Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a sharding strategy for an e-commerce platform with separate databases for products, users, and orders. Include routing logic and failover mechanisms.

best_practices: Always enable TLS encryption for QUIC synchronization in production environments
Use connection pooling to avoid creating multiple database adapters
Implement proper error handling with exponential backoff for network failures
Monitor database statistics regularly to optimize performance and cache hit rates
anti_patterns: Never expose QUIC sync ports to public internet without authentication
Avoid hardcoding IP addresses in production - use service discovery instead
Do not disable MMR when you need diverse results - it prevents echo chambers

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, AgentDB Advanced Features works with all Claude Code versions that support the agentic-flow package and Node.js 18+.

faq.question: What are the performance limits for QUIC synchronization?
faq.answer: QUIC sync supports sub-millisecond latency for up to 1000 patterns per batch, with automatic compression and retry mechanisms for reliability.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB can import/export data in JSON format and merge with existing SQLite databases using the provided CLI tools.

faq.question: How is my data secured during network synchronization?
faq.answer: QUIC uses built-in TLS 1.3 encryption for all data transmission, and you should configure firewall rules to restrict access to trusted peers only.

faq.question: Why am I getting no results from hybrid search?
faq.answer: Try relaxing your metadata filters or increasing the k parameter. Overly restrictive filters can eliminate all matching results.

faq.question: How does this compare to other vector databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB specializes in AI agent memory with reasoning capabilities, QUIC synchronization, and hybrid search - optimized for multi-agent systems rather than general vector storage.
